items.title: remove py34 support
items.body: py34 reached EOL. https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-3410/

items.title: Looking for Maintainers
items.body:
Hey @jrxFive, the repo description says that you are looking for maintainers.

I would love to volunteer time to help out.
Is there anything you're looking for in particular?

items.title: module "nomad" has no atttribute "Nomad" error
items.body:
HI,

I am trying to use nomad python client and getting following error:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "nomad_test.py", line 4, in <module>
    n = nomad.Nomad(host="10.62.27.136", timeout=5)
AttributeError: module 'nomad' has no attribute 'Nomad'

The code goes like this:
#!/usr/bin/python
import nomad
n = nomad.Nomad(host="10.62.27.136", timeout=5)
print(n)

Any help highly appreciated.

Thanks

items.title: Why split the allocation and allocations api in two modules?
items.body: They are the same API endpoint AFAIK

items.title: No data when you are using namespaces
items.body:
If you are using python-nomad with **namespaces**, you can't reach the data from this namespaces because the namespace **is not passed at the params**

See the posible solution at the follogin pull request https://github.com/jrxFive/python-nomad/pull/81

items.title: `my_nomad.jobs.parse` not documented.
items.body:
I couldn't find any documentation of the `parse` function added in pull request #55 .

I think it's a pretty critical function for actually using Nomad programmatically, since that's the form of job definition that is extensively documented and expected/written/read by users, so it would be good to have an entry in the docs for it.

items.title: `plan_job` breaking change
items.body:
[Pull request 61](https://github.com/jrxFive/python-nomad/pull/61) was a breaking change. Previously, this worked to get the diff:

    my_nomad.job.plan_job(job['ID'], {'Job': job, 'Diff': True})

This is conceptually congruent with the current interface, which requires wrapping the actual job definition dict in the `{'Job': ... }` dict which normally holds the `Diff` field as well, as one must when calling the API directly.

With the merged change, `json_dict["Diff"] = diff` will force the `Diff` to the default value of `False` when called as above.

An easy fix would be to change that line to `json_dict.setdefault('Diff', diff)`.

items.title: plan_job does not use the diff flag correctly
items.body:
According to the [docs](https://www.nomadproject.io/api/jobs.html#create-job-plan) the Nomad API expects a `Diff` parameter to be optionally supplied in the payload of the request like so: > 
{
>   "Job": "...",
>   "Diff": true,
>   "PolicyOverride": false
> }
However the code adds this as a parameter on the URL instead: https://github.com/jrxFive/python-nomad/blob/1e929b98d3c9ca8d76038eca7a7ba52d06a66afe/nomad/api/job.py#L192-L206 This results in you not being able to actually request a diff on a plan by calling `nomad.job_plan(id, job, diff=True)` since it is not put into the body and thus ignored by the Nomad server.

items.title: Add support for API v0.7
items.body: It seems that the endpoint for creating a job has changed in the version 0.7.4 of the HTTP API: https://www.nomadproject.io/api/jobs.html#create-job

items.title: Exception Handling
items.body:
Hi,
When a request  raise an error , the message is "gone" due to try except blocks on post/get function.
If i create PR will this something you are willing to merge? @jrxFive

items.title: DRY on base and private methods
items.body: Lots of repetition among all the classes with _get, _post, _delete, _put consolidate it all in base or maybe even an inherited class with dunders instead of passing the requester

items.title: Add 0.7.0 support
items.body:
Additions to the API:

- namespaces
- acl policies
- acl tokens
- sentinel policies
- search

Will have to mock enterprise calls (namespaces, sentinel)

items.title: Support Nomad 0.6 API
items.body:
Hi,
We have upgrade nomad to 0.6 and we got  exception.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/prj/poc/nomad_poc2.py", line 4, in <module>
    for a in client.jobs.get_jobs():
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nomad/api/jobs.py", line 83, in get_jobs
    return self._get()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nomad/api/jobs.py", line 67, in _get
    jobs = self._requester.get(url)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nomad/api/base.py", line 50, in get
    raise nomad.api.exceptions.BaseNomadException(response)
nomad.api.exceptions.BaseNomadException


The code for example: 

import nomad
client = nomad.Nomad(host="NOMAD_V6")
for a in client.jobs.get_jobs():
    print a

items.title: Add support to client api for reading allocation stats
items.body: Allocations stats are available through [Nomad client api](https://www.nomadproject.io/api/client.html#read-allocation), it will be useful to add them in the client api.

items.title: Feature: Add version checking for new/changed endpoints
items.body: Add a new check to see if nomad supports URI/endpoint, probably as decorator around method calls. May be a good catalyst to inherit from a base class and clean up the Request adapter.

items.title: Verify parameter is not passed down to Requests which does not allow for self-signed SSL certificates
items.body: The verify parameter is used to toggle the protocol, but it is not passed to Requests, which allows you to specify a CA bundle for self-signed certs. See http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/user/advanced/#ssl-cert-verification

items.title: Consult on nomad docker volumes
Add additional uri endpoints
items.body:
Operator
  - GET
    - raft/configuration
  - DELETE
    - raft/peer, params: address

Job
  - GET
    - id/summary
  - PUT/POST
    - id/plan, params: job, diff (optional)

items.title: support docker volume
items.body: when  should python-nomad support nomad 0.5.*, and add docker volume support?

items.title: update pypi package
items.body: The package https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-nomad/0.0.1 seems to be outdated compared to master. Can you please update it?

items.title: Validate JSON responses
items.body: Validated expected responses from integration tests and possibly mocked tests with https://pypi.python.org/pypi/jsonschema

items.title: add mocked responses to tests
items.body: Mock and verify exceptions properly raised for endpoints

items.body: add region support for requester class in nomad.api.base
